3. Calls on the Government, parties, and stakeholders to contribute to a peaceful and tolerant atmosphere for the 2012 elections.

4. Calls on Sierra Leone authorities to resolve outstanding electoral legal framework issues.

5. Urges the Government to engage in regular, inclusive party political dialogue on national issues.

6. Encourages the Executive Representative to enhance UN efforts' integration and effectiveness.

7. Requests the Secretary-General to report on progress towards meeting benchmarks.

8. Emphasizes the Government's primary responsibility for peacebuilding, security, and development.

9. Calls on the Government to combat corruption, improve accountability, and promote private sector development.

10. Encourages the Peacebuilding Commission to support the Government and UNIPSIL.

11. Commends the Government for recognizing women's roles in conflict prevention and peacebuilding.

12. Requests the Secretary-General to report every six months on UNIPSIL's mandate implementation.

13. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
